website_summaries.verdict: The Transcend 3 is a very supportive stability running shoe that many have enjoyed. Some users loved the shoe’s flexibility, comfort and cushioning but there are also a few who disliked the shoe’s narrow toe box and bulky look.  It has some of the most robust set of technologies and components for those who need underfoot cradling during daily athletic activities.
pros: The Element Mesh ensures breathable support and moisture management
Synthetic and Microfiber overlays secures the foot in a snug and efficient manner
The Element Lining and Super DNA Sock Liner ensure a comfortable inner environment feel
The Transcend 3 has mechanisms and features that mold themselves to the natural shape of the foot, thus making the wearer feel more in tune with the fit and the overall cushioning
A smoother and controlled transition from the heel to the toe is handled by segmented components that work together
The outsole is durable and it offers a reliable amount of traction over the ground
The 3rd version of the Transcend is a great shoe for those who need additional support for the pronation of their feet
cons: The Transcend 3 has an expensive price
There were runners who felt that it was a bit bulky and stiff
Others noted that it had a narrow toe box
Some noticed that it had a difficult break in period, which meant that their feet took longer to acclimate into the shoe and vice versa

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is a winner.
customer_reviews.text: Went for my first run in my brand new Transcend 3s this afternoon. These are some seriously comfy shoes. More importantly, even my untrained eye could spot that they were correcting my overpronation. There was a visible difference. And no aches and pains in the aftermath like I usually have. I'll come back and update once I put some more miles on them, but I have high hopes that these shoes will make my half marathon training more comfortable and safer. 6/12/16: After several more runs, still loving these shoes. While so still get some tenderness in my right calf, my knee and hip pain are basically gone. These shoes really do the job the are supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: J. Winn

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: The width was a bit more narrow than my last pair of Brooks but I love them overall!
customer_reviews.author: Supercalifragilistic

customer_reviews.title: Love these Brooks running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love these running shoes! Great support and cushioning. I run 12-15 miles per week and these are one of the most comfortable shoes I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Jrt

customer_reviews.title: would size up for fatty socks
customer_reviews.text: I like these but do not love these. I wish I had sized up from my typical 7.5 to an 8 so I could wear fluffy socks. I thought the rounded toe would assure actual shoe size for me........which is 7.5. They are lovely to look at! They are a little underwhelming on padding within the shoe, especially under the tongue. The base/bottom of the shoe is plenty fabulous as is the nice, wide, round toe box. Next pair I will just size up so I can wear beefy socks for top of the foot padding.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina Smart

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love Brooks Shoes! Unfortunately this was too small. I was afraid my toes would be injured from wearing too small in length. They fit, but I just did not have enough toe room between toes & end of sneaker. I will try them a 1/2 size larger. Transcend 3 is not available in this color for me, so I will have to wait or search elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great, supportive shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I wear anywhere from a 5.5 to a 6 and the 5.5 fit perfectly! These are adorable and have amazing arch support! They're great for long distance running. They're the only shoes that haven't given me shin splints and heel pain. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: New and improved version?
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn them a few times and the paint/colored coating on the toes of both shoes is already chipping off. Another cosmetic issue I have is again with the silver detailing near the top of the shoe smearing. I loved my previous pairs of Transends, they were a great shoes. This newer version doesn't seem to match up quality wise.
customer_reviews.author: CrazK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support and cushion
customer_reviews.text: My feet pronate and I have arch issues/plantar fasciitis. These shoes have been perfect for my sore feet and knees. This is the third pair of Brooks I've owned and they never fail to impress.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Desch

customer_reviews.title: Love my jogging sneakers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these sneakers for several months. I have a large arch in my feet and need all the extra support. I have used this to jog. zumba, and walking and they are surely comfortable. Fit as expected and the color is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy this again and do not recommend this version of the Transcent
customer_reviews.text: I was very unhappy this this shoe, the material was very course. The tongue of the shoe gave me a cut on both feet always had to wear higher socks to prevent the injury. Very little support at the base of the shoe after using it for one month my foot became numb. Will not buy this again and do not recommend this version of the Transcent.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Sandoli

customer_reviews.title: Supination
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I supinate and have trouble with my it bands and feet cramping. Thses shoes were made for me. No longer have these issues because of thebuild up on the outside of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: karen maitoza

customer_reviews.title: ... for about 4 years and these are the absolute BEST pair I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I've ran in Brooks for about 4 years and these are the absolute BEST pair I've ever had. For me, they work just as described and I couldn't be more pleased. I highly recommend these to anyone new to Brooks or looking for a different type of Brooks shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Pickel

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. My second pair, and always run in Brooks. They're very comfortable and sturdy. The only reason I am giving it a 4 star instead of a 5 star is because I think the toe box is wider than they used to be. My feet swish around a bit.
customer_reviews.author: KASuperior

customer_reviews.title: Had to relace the shoe laces.
customer_reviews.text: Right away I could tell how they recorrected my feet when I walked. Super comfortable and I love the color.The only problem I had with the shoes is that after 2.5 miles, my toes in my right foot fell asleep. I learned there was a different way to lace the shoes so I tried it. I went running yesterday for 6 miles and my foot was fine.
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: 2 have two sets of these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable shoes with both arch support and sidewall construction. I've had challenges finding comfortable ever since breaking my leg and ankle. I need a high level of support which these shoes provide. I had to get used to the somewhat stretchy shoe laces. No a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: ... time in these new sneakers yesterday and they feel amazing! I have been running in Brooks Transcend sneakers ...
customer_reviews.text: I ran for the first time in these new sneakers yesterday and they feel amazing! I have been running in Brooks Transcend sneakers for 3 years now and hope they do not ever become a sneaker of the past. They feel great, look great and I have never even had as much as a blister from these sneakers...LOL. I would highly recommend these to anyone who needs arch support and an all around great running shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for those who walk on the outside of their foot. I don't have pain in my legs and knees if I run with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stability shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are wonderfullying balanced between stability and flexibility. Excellent for short or long runs. I have completed a half marathon with them without any problems. The shoe fits about half a size too big for me. However everything else is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very Much improved from first generation transcend On sale and ordered a second pair to have on hand perfect for road running
customer_reviews.author: rere

customer_reviews.title: Fit just like the old ones
customer_reviews.text: I have the old transcend (had maybe 5 or 6 pairs) and was concerned that I would not like the new model but it fits perfectly. My feet can't tell the difference between old model and new. I'll continue to buy these over and over as I wear them out until they move to a transcend 4, hopefully with no major changes in fit and feel.
customer_reviews.author: JBP

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price. I found them very heavy for running or jumping activities
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great buy - stability shoe - worth buying specialty shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have to wear stabilizer running shoes bc of my falling arches. These shoes are perfect for added arch support! And cheaper than the shoe store.
customer_reviews.author: LouisianaWoman

customer_reviews.title: they're the most comfortable everyday sneakers I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a runner, but an overweight senior woman who used to wear another brand for. But a couple of years ago, they narrowed the toe box on their brand, and they were okay at first, but after developing arthritis in two toes on my left foot, I could no longer wear them, they hurt my foot so badly. So I tried these Brooks, and they not only solved my pain problem, they're the most comfortable everyday sneakers I've ever worn. I ordered another pain in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Carol C.

customer_reviews.title: Go up a half size

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, I won't change Brooks Trascends for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, I won't change Brooks Trascends for a long time. I have problems with my ankles and tibia, and these shoes give me the support I need for long distance running.
customer_reviews.author: Nubia Robleto

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Work long hours dialysis and theses shoes ...

customer_reviews.title: Design and fit are comfortable. Lightweight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits, yes. Bur the front half of the sole is very wide, and I am sometimes clumsy; it challenged me a few times when I first wore these on the treadmill. AOK now. Design and fit are comfortable. Lightweight but sturdy.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! They are super comfortable and have great cushion. I run about 5 miles per day on trails. These are definitely worth the money.

customer_reviews.text: Love these sneakers! They don't put good inserts in any sneaker anymore. They have great ones at fleet feet. I put them in all my shoes.

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these shoes! I'm between a size 8.5 and 9, and after reading the advice of other reviewers, I ordered the size 9 since these apparently run a tad small. They fit perfectly. I also love the "Diva Pink" color, although they're really more coral/orange.

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion and support

I have narrow feet, but prefer the wider toe box to allow for normal forefoot splaying while running.

customer_reviews.text: These shoes cause pain and plantar fascitis in my left foot. Definitely not a good shoe for me. And now stuck with them.

customer_reviews.title: I love this running shoes

I was suffering from knee pain because of my cheap running shoes but with this....OH MY GOODNESS what a difference. I even go longer distances and when it drizzles, my toes don't get wet.

customer_reviews.text: These are poorest quality Brooks shoes I have ever purchased and I paid more for them for any other pair of shoes. The bottom rubber pieces started coming off the second week I wore them. I am a RN and need quality shoes that last and these don't meet those criteria.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality- True Brooks or knock off?

They fit great (I ordered a half size up, as advised by the website) and they are super comfortable! I can't wait to order another pair for indoor running since it rains a lot here. I am so happy with this product and that means that my running isn't suffering from my excuses!

customer_reviews.title: Brooks are the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Brooks and I have no idea why I even bother with any other athletic shoes. Buy Brooks! They have saved me from unnecessary pain caused by other shoes. I just walked 11,000 steps and feel like I could do 11,000 more. With my other athletic shoes I was barely getting to 10,000 and after three days I had to take a week off.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes but Too Wide
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful well-made shoes. I found I can't wear the Transcend III as the toe box is too wide for my feet. I have to stick with Transcend II design. These are B-width but shoe runs wide.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: but are supportive and comfortable enough for me to get 3 miles in
customer_reviews.text: I always order my running sneakers a half size bigger than regular shoes to account for swelling while exercising. These run a smidgen small, but are supportive and comfortable enough for me to get 3 miles in. I like them so much that I think I'll be ordering another pair in a half size up for long distance!
customer_reviews.author: michelle freeman

customer_reviews.title: Walking or Running these are the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is WOW! I have tried many types of walking shoes in the past. I have, in the past, walked up to 5 miles a day. I am getting back into my regimen again so wanted to upgrade my shoes. When I tried these on I felt as though I was literally walking on clouds. I even felt like it was so soft that I would lose my balance! That went away quickly but the comfort did not. Walking or Running these shoes are the best!!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne D. Procter

customer_reviews.title: The shoe provides good support and stability but the tongue sits too high ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe provides good support and stability but the tongue sits too high up into the bend of my foot and is very stiff. Caused constant rubbing and pressure to where it irritated my skin off. If the tongue was softer and shorter it would be a good shoe.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: I am a long distance walker and I love these shoes. Your heel sits down slightly but I found this to be very good.

customer_reviews.text: I already have these shoes in aqua /purple. The old ones fit perfect and loved them. The pink ones I just got from Amazon feel too wide. Not the same.

customer_reviews.text: Am disapounted it too large i cant wear it :'(
